text: On a Clear Day is an album by American jazz organist Shirley Scott recorded in 1966 for the Impulse! label.Impulse! Records discography accessed March 29, 2011 ==Reception== The Allmusic review by Scott Yanow awarded the album 4 stars stating "The music grooves and Scott shows that she did not need a competing horn in order to come up with soulful and swinging ideas".Yanow, S. Allmusic Review accessed March 29, 2011 ==Track listing== # "On a Clear Day (You Can See Forever)" (Burton Lane, Alan Jay Lerner) - 4:48 # "What'll I Do?" (Irving Berlin) - 4:34 # "Cold Winter Blues" (Shirley Scott) - 3:48 # "All Alone" (Berlin) - 4:45 # "What the World Needs Now Is Love" (Burt Bacharach, Hal David) - 3:58 # "Corcovado" (Antonio Carlos Jobim) - 5:23 # "Days of Wine and Roses" (Henry Mancini, Johnny Mercer) - 5:20 # "Instant Blues" (Scott) - 6:15 :*Recorded in New York City on January 6, 1966 ==Personnel== *Shirley Scott -- organ *Ron Carter - bass *Jimmy Cobb - drums ==References== Category:Impulse! Records albums Category:Shirley Scott albums Category:1966 albums Category:Albums produced by Bob Thiele
title: On a Clear Day (Shirley Scott album)
